channel.title: Comments on: Nuclear Power Is The Future – Probably not…

item.title: By: DougNic
item.dc:creator: DougNic
item.description:
It is unclear to me what your position is here. Are you arguing that the world is getting cooler? If so why are the ice caps melting?
Are you saying that there is no global warming? Then I ask again, why are the ice caps melting?
I assume that the instability in the climate we are introducing into the atmosphere will cause disruptions. Do you not share that belief?
item.content:encoded:
It is unclear to me what your position is here. Are you arguing that the world is getting cooler? If so why are the ice caps melting?

Are you saying that there is no global warming? Then I ask again, why are the ice caps melting?

I assume that the instability in the climate we are introducing into the atmosphere will cause disruptions. Do you not share that belief?

item.title: By: Sun Tzu
item.dc:creator: Sun Tzu
item.description: John A. Warden III, a leading US expert in strategy made this interesing post about: <a href="http://venturist.com/wordpress/?p=33" rel="nofollow">Thinking Strategically About Global Climate Change</a>. I found it provocative and am interested in what your readers think about his idea of creating a Future state for the Global Climate before embarking on a lot of tactical solutions to solve percieved problems.
item.content:encoded: John A. Warden III, a leading US expert in strategy made this interesing post about: Thinking Strategically About Global Climate Change. I found it provocative and am interested in what your readers think about his idea of creating a Future state for the Global Climate before embarking on a lot of tactical solutions to solve percieved problems.
